i1.name: Friend of the Forest
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Ivern''' cannot attack or damage non-epic [[monster]]s. Instead, targeting a jungle camp initiates a {{fd|2.5}} seconds {{ct|channel|cast=interrupts|items=interrupts,true,,false|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}} that, upon completion, places the monsters within a ''grove''. Placing a ''grove'' costs {{sti|health|{{as|{{pp|(23.5-x)/100*({{ccd|Ivern|hp_base}}+{{ccd|Ivern|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|displayformula = (23.5%-1% per level) of base health}} health}}}} and {{sti|mana|{{as|{{pp|(34.5-1.5*x)/100*({{ccd|Ivern|mp_base}}+{{ccd|Ivern|mp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|displayformula = (34.5%-1.5% per level) of base mana}} mana}}}}, and cannot be cast if '''Ivern''' lacks the resources. The channel cannot be cancelled in the first {{fd|0.15}} seconds and in the last {{fd|0.5}} seconds.

The ''grove'' matures over {{pp|15|40|38|36|34|32|30|27|24|21|18|15|11|7|3|1|displayformula = 42-2 per level until level 6, then 3 until level 11, then 4 until level 15. ''This is capped at 1 second at level 15.''}} seconds. When fully matured, '''Ivern''' can interact with the camp again to ''free'' the monsters after {{fd|0.5}} seconds, sending them away while receiving their {{tt|{{g|full gold}} and {{sti|experience|{{as|full experience}}}}|not full when freeing Krug camp, see notes}} [[bounty|bounties]]. {{si|Smite|Smiting}} a large [[monster]] within a ''grove'' will instantly ''free'' the camp's monsters, regardless of its maturity or the monsters' current health.

If the camp's large [[monster]] has already been slain, '''Ivern''' will ''free'' the camp upon completing the channel at no cost. Similarly, the ''grove'' will instantly mature if the large monster is slain.

Starting at level 5, freeing the {{ui|Red Brambleback}} or the {{ui|Blue Sentinel}} leaves behind a ''sapling'' for 1 minute that can be picked up by an allied champion to gain the camp's buff, consuming it in the process. If at least one allied [[champion]] is nearby, '''Ivern''' can pick up the ''sapling'' to transfer it to the nearest one in range. If an ally kills either monster, they also leave behind a ''sapling'' that only '''Ivern''' can consume.
i1.notes:
* Freeing a {{tip|Krugs}} camp will only give the {{g|gold}} and {{sti|experience|{{as|experience}}}} of the present ''Krugs'', i.e the {{ui|Ancient Krug}} and a ''Medium'' {{ui|Krug}}, for a total of {{sti|experience|{{pp|4|(55+15)*(1+0.25*(x^3-x)/60)|1 to 7|type=monster's level|changedisplay=true|formula=''This is capped at monster's level 7.''|color=experience}} experience}} instead of {{pp|8|55+15+15*2+10*6; 55+15+15*2+10*6; (55+15)*1.025+15*2+10*6; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.025; (55+15)*1.1+(15*2+10*6)*1.025; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.1; (55+15)*1.25+(15*2+10*6)*1.1; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.25|type=monster's level|displayformula=''This is capped at monster's level 7, but effectively capped at level 8 because of additional krugs spawning with one less level.''|color=experience}}, and {{g|75 gold}} instead of {{g|125}}.
* ''Friend of the Forest'' can be used while '''Ivern''' or the camp is in combat and, once the ''grove'' is placed, {{si|Smite}} can be used to instantly claim the camp. Interrupting the channel or killing '''Ivern''' is the only way to contest jungle camps, short of killing the camp during the channel time.
*  If the large monster in a camp is still alive, Ivern must gain vision of it to use Friend of the Forest on that camp.
* If the large monster in a camp is still alive, Ivern will walk towards it to use Friend of the Forest. Attempting to use Friend of the Forest on the campâ€™s smaller monster will not change the total distance that Ivern walks.
* ''Friend of the Forest'' will leave '''Ivern''' at 1 current health if cast with exactly the required amount. ''Friend of the Forest'' cannot be cast with less, unlike other abilities with health costs.
* Non-epic monsters turned hostile by an allied or an enemy champion will still attack ''Ivern'' if he is the closest target (he is not immune to monster damage) yet he still cannot return fire if so (despite not being the one turning the monsters hostile)
* {{ui|Daisy}} also cannot attack non-epic [[monster]]s.
* Monsters are not hurt nor do they become hostile by '''Ivern''' when he is equipped with an item that has the [[Named_item_effect#Immolate|Immolate]] effect.
* In [[Nexus Blitz]], ''Friend of the Forest'' will not affect monsters. '''Ivern''' becomes hostile with them.

q1.name: Rootcaller
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' throws a vine in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|root|rooting}} them for a short duration.

'''Ivern''' and his allies can target enemies {{tip|root|rooted}} by ''Rootcaller'' to {{tip|dash}} to them, with allies stopping at {{sti|range|their attack range}} and '''Ivern''' stopping at {{sti|range|125 range}} from the target.
q1.notes:
* ''Rootcaller'' can hit monsters and allow '''Ivern''' to dash to them although it won't deal damage.
* '''Ivern''' can also recast this ability to dash to targets.
* '''Ivern''''s pull/attack range is determined when he dashes to the target -- not from when he initially casts ''Rootcaller'' and throws the vine.
* '''Ivern''' (and allies?) are not able to dash to the target unless they are within approximately 1200 range.

w1.name: Brushmaker
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} While in {{tip|brush}}, '''Ivern's''' basic attacks deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}. This bonus persists for 3 seconds after leaving brush.
'''Ivern''' periodically [[stocks]] a ''Brushmaker'' charge, up to a maximum of 3.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' grows a patch of brush at the target location for 30 seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area within and around it for 3 seconds. ''Brushmaker'' spawns more brush if used near terrain or other brush.
w1.notes:
* The {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} affects towers.
* {{Pending for test}}: Passive's interactions with {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodging}}, {{ai|Spirit's Refuge|Shen|blocking}}, and {{tip|blind|blinding}} effects.

e1.name: Triggerseed
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' gifts a ''Triggerseed'' to the target allied champion, himself or {{ui|Daisy}}, {{tip|shielding}} them for 2 seconds.
At the end of its duration, ''Triggerseed'' bursts, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 2 seconds.
e1.notes: *''Triggerseed'' on allied champions grants them all kill credits it causes.

r1.name: Daisy!
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' summons his sentinel friend {{ui|Daisy}} at his side, who remains {{tt|on the field|2500 leash range}} for 60 seconds as a controllable {{tip|pet}}.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Ivern''' commands ''Daisy!'' to move to the target location. If cast on '''Ivern''', {{ui|Daisy}} will follow him.
